time_series_maker¶

class evaluate.postprocessor.time_series_maker.TimeSeriesMaker¶

Bases: object

carry_forward_values(ts: dict, a: int, t: int) → dict¶

Carry forward values for an agent at a given time step. (using values from previous time step)

Parameters:

  • ts (dict) – The time series data structure.

  • a (int) – The index of the agent.

  • t (int) – The current time step.

Returns:

Updated time series data structure with carried forward values.

Return type:

dict

initialise_time_series(times: int) → dict¶

Initialize a time series structure for agents.

Returns:

A dictionary initialized with zeros for each agent’s time series data.

Return type:

dict

make_time_series_data(data: list[dict], times: int) → dict¶

Create time series data for agents based on the provided (CHANGES-ONLY) conversation data.

Parameters:

data (list[dict]) – A list of dictionaries containing only update data from conversations.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the time series data for each agent.

Return type:

dict

set_agent_start_values(ts: dict, data: dict, times: int) → dict¶

Set initial values for agents based on the first entry of the data.

Parameters:

  • ts (dict) – The time series data structure.

  • data (dict) – The first entry of the data containing agent values.

Returns:

Updated time series data structure with initial values.

Return type:

dict

update_agent_time_series(ts: dict, a: int, data: list[dict]) → dict¶

Update the time series data for a specific agent. Either with the value from the previous time step (if they haven’t interacted) or - if applicable - with the new one.

Parameters:

  • ts (dict) – The time series data structure.

  • a (int) – The index of the agent to update.

  • data (list[dict]) – The list of data entries for the agents.

Returns:

Updated time series data structure for the agent.

Return type:

dict

update_entry_for_agent(ts: dict, agent: int, t: int, entry: dict) → dict¶

Update the time series entry for a specific agent at a given time step.

Parameters:

  • ts (dict) – The time series data structure.

  • agent (int) – The index of the agent to update.

  • t (int) – The current time step.

  • entry (dict) – The entry containing update values for the agent.

Returns:

Updated time series data structure with new entry values.

Return type:

dict
